articles.title: Current Employment
articles.description: Information on my current employment and its entailing responsibilities.
articles.contents:
Research Assistant
Division of Personality and Developmental Psychology, University of Basel
(April 2021 - current)
Project Management & Data Collection, Preparation, Analysis
The major focus of my current employment is project management and data analysis work within the study to revise the Fragebogen zur Erhebung der Emotionsregulation bei Kindern und Jugendlichen (FEEL-KJ).
My project responsibilities include or have included the following:
Currently: Analysing the FEEL-KJ study data (in R Studio), wrapping up administrative tasks
required for definitive study completion and updating the FEEL-KJ test manual.
Completed data collection and preparation of the FEEL-KJ study. This included personally contacting institutions, presenting an age-appropriate presentation of the FEEL-KJ study in front of children and adolescents for study recruitment and answering inquiries regarding the study from institutions and participants.
Managed and coordinated a team of interns and master students who supported recruitement, data collection and preparation for the FEEL-KJ study.
Organized and completed data collection for the FEEL-KJ pilot study to re-standardize and re-validate the FEEL-KJ and analysed the data from the pilot study.
Organized and set-up both the FEEL-KJ pilot study and proper study to re-standardize and re-validate the FEEL-KJ from the start of the project, including the literature search, selection of test batteries to include in the study, planning of the study setup and composition of the proposal for the regional ethic’s committee.
Managed administrative tasks necessary for study implementation, including procurement and establishment of the physical and digital data management and online survey infrastructure; the latter in conjunction with the faculty’s IT team. Furthermore, was responsible for tracking the study expanses, for procuring study participation compensation and for finding, interviewing and hiring interns for the FEEL-KJ-study.
Supervision of Masters Students
A minor focus of my current employment further contains supervision of master students within the masters project test development, which consisted of these responsibilities:
Supervised and supported master students throughout their master thesis. This included regular meetings to discuss thesis progress, written and oral feedback on thesis progress, as well as evaluation of and report creation on the final version of the master thesis.
Co-supervised the course adjoining the masters project along with two other colleagues. This included discussing the course schedule and organizational matters with co-supervisors, planning, preparing and teaching seminary lessons to master students, evaluating homework tasks for aforementioned lessons and giving feedback on master students’ presentations.
Ph.D. Student
Division of Personality and Developmental Psychology, University of Basel
(April 2021 - current)
Simultaneously to my project-work listed above, I’m working on attaining my Ph.D. at the University of Basel. The overarching theme is on children’s and adolesecents’ emotion regulation of their negative emotions. That is, how children and adolescents deal with their anger, sadness and fear.
To eventually attain my Ph.D., I am fulfilling or have fulfilled the subsequent responsibilities:
Currently: Working on my second manuscript.
Presentation of research at (international) conferences.
Writing and publication of scientific articles.
Preparation and analysis of various datasets.
Investigation of relevant research topics for the overarching theme of my dissertation and formulating relevant research questions as well as hypotheses.
Regularly attending workshops/courses for refining relevant technical skills (e.g. specific data analysis methods) or transferable skills (e.g. improve general project management skills).

articles.title: Project News
articles.description: Updates on the project I'm currently managing.
articles.contents:
Study to Revise the Fragebogen zur Erhebung der Emotionsregulation bei Kindern und Jugendlichen (FEEL-KJ)
General Information
The Fragebogen zur Erhebung der Emotionsregulation bei Kindern und Jugendlichen (FEEL-KJ)
is a questionnaire that is utilized in school and clinical psychology to assess how children and adolescents aged 10 - 19 years regulate their anger, sadness and fear. Children and adolescents can deal with these emotions using adaptive or maladaptive strategies. Frequent use of the latter is disadvantageous for children’s and adolescents’ well-being, whereas frequent use of adaptive emotion regulation strategies is beneficial for their well-being. Therefore, applied psychologist want to improve the use of adaptive and decrease the use of maladaptive emotion regulation strategies in help-seeking children and adolescents. The FEEL-KJ is a means for applied psychologists to gain further insight into a help-seeking child’s or adolescents’ use of adaptive and maladaptive emotion regulation strategies.
The current study’s aim, lead by Prof. Dr. Alexander Grob and managed by me, is to collect data to psychometrically examine and revise the FEEL-KJ. This will ensure that assessments resulting from the implementation of the FEEL-KJ are reliable and useful for applied psychologists helping children and adolescents, as well as researchers investigating the subject of emotion regulation in children and adolescents.
You can find more detailed information on the official FEEL-KJ study website .
Updates on the FEEL-KJ Study
We have completed data collection and are completing administrative and archival tasks for
study termination. Moreover, the study data is currently being analysed.
